parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Anti-lock Braking System (ABS) Hydraulic Unit Failure
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the ABS Hydraulic Unit can cause the front brake lever to become resistant or frozen, making it difficult or impossible to slow down or stop the motorcycle, which can lead to accidents or injuries.
symptoms: The front brake lever becomes resistant or frozen
the front brakes do not actuate
the brake lever requires forceful pressing to slow down
the motorcycle crashes or loses control.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the rear brake light switch can cause the rear brakes to stop working, making it difficult or impossible to slow down or stop the motorcycle, which can lead to accidents or injuries.
symptoms: The rear brake light switch melts

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Compensator Failure Leading to Starting Issues and Battery Drain
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the compensator can cause the battery to drain, leading to starting issues, which can leave the rider stranded and potentially cause accidents.
symptoms: The bike has difficulty starting or will not start
the bike has intermittent starting issues

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the throttle-by-wire system can cause the motorcycle to enter "limp mode" or "breakdown mode", resulting in a sudden loss of power and throttle response, which can lead to accidents, especially in heavy traffic or high-speed conditions.
symptoms: but the throttle response is limited to a low RPM only mode
making it difficult to maintain speed or accelerate; the motorcycle may enter "limp mode" or "breakdown mode" without warning
causing a loss of power and throttle response.
